intro: Ajania breviloba, commonly known as the narrowleaf ajania, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Ajania breviloba produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
